alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:01AM EST until December 19 at 12:36AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bucks and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 AM EST, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - For Wissahickon Creek at Fort Washington: At 8:30am the stage was 11.64 feet. Flood Stage is 10 feet. ... For Neshaminy Creek at Penns Park: At 8:30am the stage was 17.65 feet. Flood Stage is 13 feet. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 335 and 345. Northeast Extension near mile marker 23. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
